events.name: FCL Lunch Talk: Structures as Sensors
events.description:
Indirect Monitoring of Humans and Surrounding through Structural VibrationThis presentation introduces indirect sensing in cyber-physical systems that infers desired information   using structures as sensors (through physical structural vibration responses) instead of directly measuring sensing targets. Smart structures are designed to sense, understand, and respond to various situations involving humans and surrounding environment, to enhance user productivity, safety, and quality of life. Current approaches involve dense deployment of dedicated sensors, which makes large scale monitoring challenging. Advantages of indirect monitoring are 1) multiple types of target information can be obtained by sensing only structural responses; 2) sparse sensing configuration is possible by utilizing structural properties; and 3) privacy is better preserved due to the hidden and indirect nature of the approach. The structures of interest include buildings and vehicles. In buildings, various information on human behavior (e.g., location, height, weight, etc.), building systems (structural health, heating systems, etc.), and environment (e.g., traffic, weather, etc.) can be indirectly inferred from high-resolution, high-frequency structural vibration data. In vehicles, we can diagnose the vehicle, infrastructures, and humans based on vehicular vibration data. Through our collaboration with government and industry partners, we have deployed several buildings and train systems to validate and apply our research.
Speaker: Hae Young Noh
Hae Young Noh is an assistant professor in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering and a courtesy assistant professor in the Electrical and Computer Engineering at Carnegie Mellon University. Her research interest is in indirect sensing to infer information about dynamic systems using statistical signal processing and machine learning techniques, particularly algorithm development for smart structures and systems to conserve energy and resources, provide safe, functional, and sustainable environments, and improve people’s quality of life. Her current research projects include vehicle-based infrastructure monitoring and building vibration based human and environment sensing. She received her Ph.D. and M.S. degrees in the Civil and Environmental Engineering department and the second M.S. degree in Electrical Engineering at Stanford University. She studied Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering at Cornell University as an undergraduate.
events.location: Incubator, Singapore‑ETH Centre, #06‑01, CREATE Tower, 1 CREATE Way, Singapore 138602

events.name: A*PECSS Tech Talk Lab to Market: Advanced Manufacturing for Better Health
events.description:
Program Outline:



We would like to invite you to participate in A*PECSS tech talk series: Lab to Market: Thematic Conversations Between ECRs with SMEs and Startups. 
Here is a brief summary of the event:  
Purpose of Lab to Market:
The purpose of the tech talk series would be to bring more awareness to SMEs and startups regarding latest technological advances and product development within A*STAR. This will also provide a networking platform for SMEs and startups to strike up conversations or initiate collaborations with A*STAR early career researchers (ECRs), and a perspective of the local market needs and economy directions for A*STAR ECRs.  
Coming up in June, Advanced Manufacturing for Better Health is the main theme and a group of speakers comprising commercialisation expert, scientist and local industry representative will be giving concise and interesting presentations on that day.
Date & Time: June 30th Thursday 5.30-6.30pm
Venue: A*START Central, Blk 79, Ayer Rajah Crescent, #05-01, JTC Launchpad (Opp Fusionopolis), Singapore 139955
Schedule 
5.30-5.45pm
Manufacturing Technologies for The Healthcare Sector

Mr. Chang Chang Kuo (Senior Vice President, ETPL, A*STAR)
Chang Kuo is Snr. VP and Head of the Advanced Manufacturing and Engineering Cluster in ETPL (Exploit Technologies Pte Ltd), the technology transfer arm of Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR). He leads a team responsible for the commercialization of technologies from A*STAR’s Manufacturing and Engineering Materials IP portfolios. He brings to the role more than ten years of experience in the field of Technology Licensing and Intellectual Property management. Prior to joining ETPL, Chang Kuo has held various leadership appointments in the manufacturing and product development space over a span of eleven years in the Semiconductor industry, and is inventor of several US granted patents in the field of silicon wafer processing that have since been commercialized. 
He received his M.Sc in Mechatronics and B.Eng in Chemical Engineering from the National University of Singapore (NUS) and Master of Training & Development from the Griffith University (Australia).

5.45-6.00pm
Micro and Nano Filtration Technology: A Healthier Way for Manufacturing

Dr. Dong Xuecheng (Scientist, SIMTech, A*STAR)
Dr Dong Xuecheng is a materials scientist at the Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology. He obtained his PhD in Materials Science from the University of Cincinnati in 2012. His research interests include surface treatments for light metal corrosion protection as well as filtration and water treatment at the micro- and nano-level.

6.00-6.15pm
Membrane Technology and Applications in Desalination and Water Reuse Industry 
Ms. Chen Sijie (Principal Engineer, Hyflux Ltd)
Ms. Chen Sijie is a principal process engineer at Hyflux. She received her MSc in Environmental Science and Engineering from SSP program, a joint program between NTU and Stanford University in 2007. She has 10 years of experience in the industry of desalination and water reuse with a focus of membrane related technology including microfiltration, ultrafiltration, reverse osmosis and forward osmosis, and worked mainly on process design with practical experience on testing and commissioning.
6.15pm onwards
Networking session with refreshments and wine
events.location: A*START Central, #05-01, JTC Launchpad, Blk 79, Ayer Rajah Crescent, Opposite to Fusionopolis, Singapore 139955

events.name: WordPress Meetup (June 2016)
events.description:
Hello! The next meet up will feature two experts from Tech In Asia and they will be speaking about how they're using WordPress with other key popular web technologies such as React. If you ever wanted to know how they did it, and why they did it. Join us! Talks:  Moving Beyond WordPress in Tech in Asia: Back-End Engineering  (WordPress API)Lester Chan - Head of Engineering, Tech in Asia, also made the popular plugin WP-PageNavi Moving Beyond WordPress in Tech in Asia: Front-end Engineering Melvin Lee - Web Engineer , Tech in Asia 


Community Open Space: bring your WordPress questions and let the community help you with it!  Are you interested in sharing something about WordPress as well? Let us know!  Venue: Amazon Web Services' building management requires you to bring a photo ID to exchange for an access card into the building. Do join us from 7pm for a 7:30pm start. Please call Jon at[masked] if you have an issue getting to the meetup. Do not abuse the number please :) We're always looking for speakers and volunteers to help with our meetups! Please contact Valentine, Jon or Robert if you're interested in helping out.
events.location: Amazon Web Services Office, Level 10 Capital Square, 23 Church Street, Singapore 049481
